metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5755 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Incorrect handling of negative zero in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 72.0.3626.81 allowed a remote attacker to perform arbitrary read/write via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5755` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '72.0.3626.119-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
